p: Cameroon a sub-Saharan African country situated in Central West Africa, harbours 67% of the Worlds HIV infection [ 15]. Cameroon endorsed the WHO test and treat recommendation in June 2016 [ 16]. Before the endorsement, in 2011 the prevalence of HIV/AIDS epidemic for women was almost twice that of men (5.6% Vs 2.9%) with the greatest epidemiological burden in urban settings [ 17]. Meanwhile ARV drugs through the Ministry of Public Health have been made available free since May 2007 in the National territory of Cameroon for the management of people living with HIV/AIDS (PLHIV) [ 18, 19], with a total of 151 HIV treatment centers all around the national territory by the end of 2011 [ 19, 20]. By 2016, there were 205,359 clients receiving HAART [ 16], as compared to 145,038 clients in 2014 [ 21], showing a rapid scale-up of HAART.
